Subhead: In this interview, Philippe Conte, a professor emeritus of criminal law at Université Panthéon-Assas, says the judges in the 'Libyan financing' case merely enforced the laws written by those now denouncing them.

Morocco unveils reforms to boost youth participation and address social unrest
Subhead: The package of reforms are aimed at encouraging young people to enter politics and improving public education and healthcare, following weeks of youth-led protests over inequality and corruption.

Title: Dozens killed in Gaza as Israel says it is once again observing ceasefire
Subhead: Israel said Sunday it had resumed enforcing the Gaza ceasefire after a wave of strikes that killed at least 45 people, accusing Hamas of violating the truce – a claim the group denies.

Title: Germany's former chancellor Gerhard Schröder questioned on Nord Stream 1 and 2
Subhead: Schröder defended the construction of the two gas pipelines and the need for his country, which was preparing to phase out nuclear power, to rely on Russian gas.

Title: After Charlie Kirk's murder, Europe's far right swears allegiance to Trump's politics
Subhead: In the hours after the ultra-conservative American activist's death, representatives of Europe's far-right movements echoed the rhetoric of the MAGA world in unison, transforming Charlie Kirk, who was previously a little-known figure in Europe, into a 'martyr' for their common cause.

Tommy Robinson, a racist hooligan turned mass mobilizer
Subhead: 'The new faces of the far right' (1/5). Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, known as Tommy Robinson, has seen his following surge in the UK since Elon Musk reinstated his X account. His ability to mobilize tens of thousands has placed him at the center of British politics.

Title: Olivier Burtin, historian: 'Trump presents himself as war leader of a domestic conflict'
Subhead: In an op-ed, the US specialist revisits the long history of far-right rhetoric about the 'enemy within.' According to Burtin, President Trump has turned this narrative into a genuine mode of governance, one capable of justifying authoritarian policies and increasing militarization, to the point of redefining American territory as a battlefield.

Title: Gerhard Richter on display at the Fondation Louis Vuitton
Subhead: With 271 works − including rare loans − on display, this is the largest retrospective ever devoted to the German artist. It opens in Paris on October 17.
